item.title: Can Demna Save Gucci?
item.description: The inside story of how the designer is transforming the brand — and himself.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:credit: Federico Barbieri for The New York Times
item.media:description: Demna in his new office at Gucci headquarters with his Chihuahuas, Chiquita, left, and Cookie.

item.title: The Devil Wears Sasuphi
item.description: A fledgling collection of elegant, easy to wear clothes designed by women is enjoying a flurry of visibility thanks to “The Devil Wears Prada 2.”
item.dc:creator: Laura Rysman

item.title: At the State of the Union, the White Pantsuit Protest That Didn’t Work
item.description: Democratic congresswomen put out a call to wear white at the State of the Union. It didn’t work.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
item.media:description: Members of Congress listened as President Trump delivered his State of the Union address to a joint session of Congress.

item.title: Need an Outfit? Pickle Clothing Rental App Helps Users Stay on Trend.
item.description: Pickle, a new peer-to-peer apparel-rental app, helps users stay on trend without having to go into debt or rely on climate-unfriendly fast fashion.
item.dc:creator: Kasia Pilat

item.title: At London Fashion Week, Attire Comes With Sparkling Personality
item.description: Bold shoulders, dramatic proportions and opulent accessories lent lively touches to ensembles on runways and streets during London Fashion Week.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha

item.title: Yondr Pouches, a Solution to School Phone Bans, Are No Match for Teens
item.description: In some schools, Yondr, a pouch marketed to keep kids off devices, has proved no match for actual children.
item.dc:creator: Madison Malone Kircher and Callie Holtermann
item.media:credit: Photo illustration by Tonje Thilesen for The New York Times

item.title: BAFTAs Red Carpet: Paul Mescal, Teyana Taylor and Other Unforgettable Looks
item.description: Swishy suits, mermaid skirts, skunk feet and more.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk
item.category: British Academy of Film and Television
item.media:description: The Prince and Princess of Wales graced the British Academy of Film and Television Awards in coordinated formal wear.

item.title: Lola Kirke, the Original West Village Girl
item.description: The “Sinners” actress, the youngest daughter of the Kirke family of artists, returned to New York for a combination concert-and-book tour.
item.dc:creator: Maggie Lange
item.media:credit: Jutharat Pinyodoonyachet for The New York Times

item.title: Looks Aren’t Everything? Clavicular Begs to Differ.
item.description: Braden Peters, known as Clavicular, has emerged as a beacon for a group of narcissistic, status-obsessed young men. He wants to take his fixation with “looksmaxxing” mainstream.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Bernstein
item.media:credit: Cassidy Araiza for The New York Times
item.media:description: The 20-year-old streamer goes to extremes to achieve an ideal of male beauty, but that’s not the only reason he’s become an online sensation.

item.title: How ‘Heated Rivalry’ Thawed the Chill Between My Father and Me
item.description: A racy show about a romance between male hockey players was not an obvious candidate for me to bond with my 89-year-old father.
item.dc:creator: David Samuel Levinson

item.title: First They Worked the Case. Then They Made It Personal.
item.description: Nicole Revenaugh and Marisa O’Gara met when they were co-counsel on a case challenging a Kansas law. They didn’t expect to find love.
item.dc:creator: Stella Raine Chu

item.title: He Secured Last-Minute ‘Hamilton’ Tickets Just to See Her
item.description: From finding the hottest ticket in town to converting to Judaism, Julian LeCraw III spared no effort to win over Danielle Toth.
item.dc:creator: Elie Levine

item.title: Changing Up His Routine Led to Love
item.description: Mark Van Wye might have never met Helena Brown had he not decided to take a different Pilates class more than three years ago.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Vora

item.title: At Jil Sander, It Could All Be So Simple
item.description: Simone Bellotti continues to make the case for brainy minimalism. Also, some memorable Moncler jackets and an Italian signore with unforgettable style.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher
item.media:description: Slouch par excellence at Jil Sander.

item.title: Why Was Mark Zuckerberg Front Row at Prada?
item.description: The Meta chief executive’s presence in Milan seemed to project his company’s ambitions.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher
item.media:description: The Meta chief executive, dressed in a tan polo, sat next to his wife, Priscilla Chan, and a Prada executive.

item.title: At Sauna Fest, New Yorkers Find Refuge in Curated Sweat Sessions
item.description: This harsh winter, some New Yorkers found refuge at Sauna Fest in Domino Park in Brooklyn, with curated sweat sessions led by towel-swinging sauna masters.
item.dc:creator: Kasia Pilat

item.title: My Son’s Wife Berates Him. Should I Step In?
item.description: Our Ask the Therapist columnist, Lori Gottlieb, advises a reader who feels frozen amid family conflict.
item.dc:creator: Lori Gottlieb

item.title: Maria Grazia Chiuri Lets the Fur Fly at Fendi
item.description: Maria Grazia Chiuri makes her debut, and courts controversy. Sort of.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:description: Something for everyone was the overriding message.

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘If He Doesn’t Come, I’ll Marry You’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

item.title: A Woman I Know Monopolizes Every Conversation. How Do I Make It Stop?
item.description: A reader has had it with an acquaintance’s endless, self-obsessed monologues, which have become a frequent subject of discussion behind the woman’s back.
item.dc:creator: Philip Galanes

item.title: ‘Modern Love’: I Didn’t Want to Have Kids. My Husband Did. Could Our Marriage Survive?
item.description: Helena de Groot thought she had decided not to become a mother. But, she found, she had to make that decision over and over again.
item.dc:creator: Anna Martin, Reva Goldberg, Emily Lang, Davis Land, Sara Curtis, Elisa Gutierrez, Jen Poyant, Lynn Levy, Daniel Ramirez, Dan Powell, Elisheba Ittoop, Carole Sabouraud and Pat McCusker
item.media:credit: Photo Illustration by The New York Times; Background: Brian Rea; Inset photo: John Lamparski/Getty Images for Tribeca Festival

item.title: Why Democratic Congresswomen Wore White to Trump’s State of the Union Again
item.description: It’s not the first time some Democratic women have displayed unity by wearing the same color, but this time it was in part to signal opposition to the SAVE America Act.
item.dc:creator: Jesse McKinley
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: Some Democratic congresswomen donned the same color for the president’s State of the Union address, while dozens of other Democrats boycotted the event.

item.title: The Best of London Fashion
item.description: A look at a blah Burberry show and feistier brands that made a stronger impression.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

item.title: The Couple Who Wed During Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl Performance Share Their Story
item.description: The wedding of Eleisa Aparicio and Thomas Wolter was seen by millions, but in their first interview, the newlyweds share the story of how they got to Santa Clara, Calif., with Bad Bunny signing as their witness.
item.dc:creator: Sadiba Hasan
item.media:description: Eleisa Aparicio and Thomas Wolter, two registered nurses from the greater Los Angeles area, were married at the Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara, Calif., on Feb. 8, 2026. Around 70,000 people were in attendance.

item.title: Street Style Look of the Week: Clothes to Blend In
item.description: A student’s attire suggested a desire to be incognito.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha

item.title: Mattel’s American Girl Dolls Get a Gen Z Makeover for 40th Anniversary
item.description: A new line from Mattel lifts six of the dolls out of their historical contexts and drops them into contemporary fashions. Purists aren’t pleased.
item.dc:creator: Gina Cherelus

item.title: Ilia Malinin Performed His Final Winter Olympics Skate in Balmain Jeans
item.description: For his final skate at the Winter Olympics in Italy, Ilia Malinin traded a spangly body suit for a hoodie and (designer) jeans.
item.dc:creator: Yola Mzizi
item.media:description: Ilia Malinin wore Balmain jeans with a hoodie sold by the rapper NF for his performance at the Winter Olympics figure skating exhibition gala on Saturday.

item.title: Jeff and Lauren Sánchez Bezos Will Be Honorary Chairs of the Met Gala
item.description: The news came tucked into the second page of a recent news release.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:credit: Krista Schlueter for The New York Times
item.media:description: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez Bezos at a Kering Foundation gala in New York in September.

item.title: Met Gala Dress Code Makes a Statement of Its Own: ‘Fashion Is Art’
item.description: Three words of guidance is all guests will have to go on when preparing for this year’s Costume Institute benefit, celebrating a cerebral exhibition about the “dressed body.”
item.dc:creator: Gina Cherelus
item.media:description: Dresses to be featured in the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s spring Costume Institute exhibition, which the Met Gala ceremonially kicks off.

item.title: Prince William and Kate Made a Pointed Appearance at BAFTA
item.description: After Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor’s arrest, the Prince and Princess of Wales made a pointed BAFTA appearance.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.category: British Academy of Film and Television
item.media:description: The Prince and Princess of Wales arriving at the BAFTAS with Jane Millichip, the chief executive of the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, and Ken Olisa, the Lord-Lieutenant of Greater London, on Sunday.

item.title: Should I Stop Wearing My Greatcoat Because of ICE Raids?
item.description: Recently, the military-style outerwear has taken on new meaning. Our critic traces shifting clothing connotations and offers advice on how to react.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:description: Gregory Bovino of the U.S. Border Patrol, wearing his greatcoat in Minneapolis last month.

item.title: Willie Colón Played Up the Bad Guy With Purpose
item.description: By styling himself after mobsters and blaxploitation characters early in his career, Mr. Colón, the legend of salsa music who died on Saturday, crafted an everlasting image.
item.dc:creator: Sandra E. Garcia
item.media:credit: Globe Photos/ZUMA Press Wire, via Shutterstock
item.media:description: Willie Colón was a salve for the Latino youth of the 1960s. He became an avatar for young Latinos who could not style themselves after John Wayne, Muhammad Ali or Elvis Presley.

item.title: 2026 BAFTA Awards Photos: Looks From the Red Carpet
item.description: Teyana Taylor, Paul Mescal, Michael B. Jordan and the Prince of Wales turned out in style for Britain’s biggest celebration of film.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk
item.category: British Academy of Film and Television
item.media:description: Timothée Chalamet, nominated for best leading actor for “Marty Supreme,” arrived in Givenchy.

item.title: Lisa Rinna Tells All in New Memoir, Including ‘Real Housewives’ and More
item.description: The outrageous reality TV star has written a memoir — part evolution, part exorcism. She’s more than ready to tell you why.
item.dc:creator: Joumana Khatib
item.category: The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills (TV Program)
item.media:credit: Ariel Fisher for The New York Times

item.title: Theodore Conklin, 77, Dies; His Rescue of an Inn Helped Save Sag Harbor
item.description: By rehabilitating the American Hotel, he turned a hard-luck village on the East End of Long Island into a mecca for pop stars and plumbers alike.
item.dc:creator: Penelope Green

item.title: Six Rising Fashion Designers Who Have Our Attention
item.description: These talents are showing their work in London, Milan or Paris.
item.dc:creator: Kin Woo

item.title: Fred Segal Has a New Owner. This Time It’s Aritzia.
item.description: The storied Los Angeles retailer, once recognized as an arbiter of West Coast style, has been acquired by the mass-market brand Aritzia.
item.dc:creator: Yola Mzizi
item.category: Fred Segal Home (Los Angeles, Calif, Retailer)
item.media:description: Fred Segal founded his namesake brand in 1961 and opened its first store in Los Angeles that same year. The brand quickly gained attention with the private school set, musicians and mothers and daughters looking to splurge.

item.title: Dad, You’re (So Not) Embarrassing Me at This Concert
item.description: Across the country, dads are donning sparkly blazers and purple wigs to bond with their Gen Z and Alpha kids on their own turf, be it the Eras Tour or “KPop Demon Hunters.”
item.dc:creator: Ashley Spencer

item.title: Do You Back Into a Parking Spot or Back Out?
item.description: An exploration of what’s driving a change in America’s parking lots.
item.dc:creator: Steven Kurutz
item.media:credit: Bryan Birks for The New York Times
item.media:description: In 2020, AAA updated its curriculum to advise drivers to back into parking spaces.

item.title: See a Museum Through Bruno Goppion’s Eyes? He’d Rather You Not.
item.description: For three generations, Bruno Goppion’s family has supplied display cases to the world’s top museums. What others look through, he can’t look past.
item.dc:creator: Sandra E. Garcia
item.media:credit: Francesca Forquet for The New York Times
item.media:description: Bruno Goppion in one of his family’s workshops outside Milan.

item.title: Brooklyn Beckham Spices Up Miami Burger Bash With His Own Hot Sauce
item.description: Amid a family spat that has kept his name in headlines, Brooklyn Beckham joined hundreds to eat burgers on a beach.
item.dc:creator: Linda Marx
item.category: South Beach Wine and Food Festival
item.media:credit: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times
item.media:description: Brooklyn Beckham, a host of the Burger Bash at this year’s Food Network South Beach Wine & Food Festival, mingled with attendees at the start of the event on Thursday.

item.title: Husbands and Boyfriends Step Into Olympic Spotlight
item.description: Here come the “HABs,” the attention-seeking husbands and boyfriends of medal-winning athletes.
item.dc:creator: Scott Cacciola
item.media:description: The influencer Jake Paul reacts after his fiancée, the Dutch speedskater Jutta Leerdam, won the gold medal in the 1,000-meter race.

item.title: Epstein Scandal Leaves Some Young Trump Voters Feeling Betrayed
item.description: Drawn to President Trump for his pledge to take down the political elite, some of his young constituents say he has failed them.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Taylor Pemberton
item.media:credit: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times
item.media:description: As President Trump and prominent right-wing voices try to downplay the revelations of the Epstein files, some young conservatives are losing faith in the Make America Great Again movement.

item.title: A NYC Chinese Restaurant’s Lunar New Year T-Shirts Are a Coveted Collector’s Item
item.description: A New York restaurant’s Lunar New Year merchandise has become a coveted collector’s item.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Sherman and Hiroko Masuike
item.media:description: Wo Hop, which opened in Lower Manhattan in 1938, has included seasonal Lunar New Year T-shirts in its merchandise offerings since 2012.
